Articles.Content:
Welcome to Wolf Aerospace!, Here you'll find a lot of useful bits and pieces to add to your rockets. What I want the most is to both fill gaps in the stock game (Launch escape systems, radial engines, solid rockets) and remake some stuff that doesn't quite fit my idea of how they should look (Perfectrons). Everything here is, or at least I make it look, stockalike. I also try to keep all the stuff balanced in both cost and performance so that they are not out of place in career.

RELEASES

Perfectrons 2 - v0.3

The perfectrons are my attempt at realistically looking separation engines. Not only do they look cool, but they also make separations look realistic. They also pack quite a punch and fire in a short burst.

New version of the perfectrons, now with 2 extra flavors.

Retrotrons: A retro-rocket based alternative, ideal for separating main columns and other vertical stuff. - Now with less thrust and longer burn time.

Lateraltrons: The legacy perfectrons, now revamped to match the new look - Smaller version now included

Perfectrons: Now firing straight, so that you only need one to separate small stuff.

Please read:

The LES do include decouplers so you don't need to add your own. Follow the instrucions below (they are short, I promise) for optimal usage:

THE STAGING EVENT ACTIVATES BOTH THE ENGINES AND THE DECOUPLER

-For normal flight operation (No emergencies, just the normal LES separation when nearing orbit)

--Just use the staging event.

-For Emergencies

--Set the "Toggle engine" option to your abort action group (or whatever action group you want to use)

--Set the "Decouple" option to any other action group OR use the staging event. Given the fuel is depleted, the staging event will just separate the tower.

You can decouple the tower by using the docking port's "decouple node" option, but the tower won't go away, as docking ports have near 0 decoupling force.

If I'm not wrong, all it'll take is a radial attachment instead of a stack one, and obviously placed on the correct position. After I'm finished with the "standard" ones I'll try everything you guys suggested.

MODULE

{

name = ModuleDecouple

ejectionForce = 250

explosiveNodeID = top

}

this will give any part decoupler functionality. It's just a straight yank from the stock decoupler code. I slapped this baby inside the cfg for a new set of docking ports i made for myself (Explode-O-Trons!) and they work fine, while still working as docking ports. I think. Haven't actually tried to re-dock with them yet. You'll wanna tweak the values to whatever node you need and how much force etc. Hope that helps.

edit: oops, didnt notice page 2. you could make like a small fairing that would hide the docking port, then when you jettison the escape tower the fairing would jettison too. or, alternatively, use an in-line docking port.
